bug.author: tinothy22
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
`D:\Anaconda3\envs\pytorch\python.exe D:/zqtgit/yolov3/train.py Namespace(accumulate=2, adam=False, arc='default', batch_size=1, bucket='', cache_images=False, cfg='cfg/yolov3.cfg', data='data/template.data', device='', epochs=50, evolve=False, img_size=416, img_weights=False, multi_scale=False, name='', nosave=False, notest=False, prebias=False, rect=False, resume=False, transfer=False, var=None, weights='weights/yolov3.pt') Using CUDA device0 _CudaDeviceProperties(name='GeForce GTX 1660 Ti with Max-Q Design', total_memory=6144MB) Reading labels (6367 found, 0 missing, 0 empty for 6367 images): 100%|‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà| 6367/6367 [00:00<00:00, 8817.73it/s] Model Summary: 222 layers, 6.15291e+07 parameters, 6.15291e+07 gradients Starting training for 50 epochs... <denchmark-code> Epoch gpu_mem GIoU obj cls total targets img_size </denchmark-code>
0%| | 0/6367 [00:00<?, ?it/s] Process finished with exit code -1073741819 (0xC0000005)` Since my system cuda is 10.0 and torch version is 1.2, so I downloaded the version on November 24th. During the training process, an error is reported. Is it due to environmental problems?

comments.comment: Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tinothy22>@tinothy22</denchmark-link> , thank you for your interest in our work! Please visit our <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data>Custom Training Tutorial</denchmark-link> to get started, and see our <denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1G8T-VFxQkjDe4idzN8F-hbIBqkkkQnxw>Google Colab Notebook</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov3>Docker Image</denchmark-link> , and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/GCP-Quickstart>GCP Quickstart Guide</denchmark-link> for example environments. If this is a bug report, please provide screenshots and minimum viable code to reproduce your issue, otherwise we can not help you.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tinothy22>@tinothy22</denchmark-link> possibly. If you need a working environment try these. <denchmark-h:h2>Reproduce Our Environment</denchmark-h>
To access an up-to-date working environment (with all dependencies including CUDA/CUDNN, Python and PyTorch preinstalled), consider a:
GCP Deep Learning VM with $300 free credit offer: GCP Quickstart Guide Google Colab Notebook with 12 hours of free GPU time: Google Colab Notebook Docker Image from https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov3. See Docker Quickstart Guide
